body.p:
Falmouth October 22nd 1861
Beriah Magoffin governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
I herewith Send you an additional Petition for the pardon of Geoge Knorr from Newport including 11 of the Trail Jury Praying for the Pardon of said Knorr.

his wife is now at her fathers with her chid boath sick and his father is Sick and a very poor man and if they can not git Some Relief Some way they will undaubtedly Suffer, I hope you will give the said Knorrs case a mercifully ^hearing^ and if you can pardon him do it as Soon as possable that he may releive the suffering ^hearing^ condition of his wife, and child

I am Sir your obt servant,
E. A. W. Roberts
Aditianal Petition with 11 of the Trail Juror's Signed
